item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 340
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. HEADLINES 2. SPONSOR 3. RECAP 4. PERL REVIEW 5. RAKU REVIEW 6. CHART 7. NEW MEMBERS 8. GUESTS 9. TASK #1: Duplicate Removals 10. TASK #2: Ascending Numbers HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #340 of The Weekly Challenge. Welcome back, Torgny Lyon, and thanks for your contributions in Perl and bonus blog post. Welcome back, Mariano Spadaccini and thanks for contributions in Elixir, Go, Perl, Python and Ruby.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 339
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. HEADLINES 2. SPONSOR 3. RECAP 4. PERL REVIEW 5. RAKU REVIEW 6. CHART 7. NEW MEMBERS 8. GUESTS 9. TASK #1: Max Diff 10. TASK #2: Peak Point HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #339 of The Weekly Challenge. Once again, the quality of guest contributions continues to improve week after week and the blog posts are maintaining their high standard. I’ve noticed that Rust continues to rise and is soon expected to surpass 1000 contributions while Python continues to maintain it’s #1 rank.

item.title: Design Pattern Factory
item.description: DISCLAIMER: Image is generated using ChatGPT. 1. Introduction 2. Define Shape Role 3. Implement Concrete Shapes 4. Create Shape Factory 5. Test Factory Introduction In Jan 2021, I created a small project called, Design Pattern using Modern Perl where I explored many design patterns using Moo. The project became quite popular and received positive feedback on GitHub. When the experimental class feature was first introduced in Perl v5.38 (released in July 2023, I decided to re-visit the project and re-implement the patterns using this new feature.
